article_title: Alan Blinder: ObamaCare Is a Job-Killer? Not at All
article_text:
The political echo chamber reverberated loudly last week after a new Congressional Budget Office report allegedly projected that cumulative job growth over the next 3-10 years could be 2 million-2.5 million lower because of the Affordable Care Act (ACA). Does that mean "ObamaCare" is a job killer? Not at all. But to understand why, we need to take a trip down memory lane—back to Economics 101.

The essential point is to distinguish between changes in demand and changes in supply. If something happens to decrease...

twitter.description: In The Wall Street Journal, Alan S. Blinder writes that the pro-growth effects of the law's lower health costs will swamp any antigrowth effects from a lower labor supply.
twitter.title: ObamaCare Is a Job-Killer? Not at All
